author: Jack Goods
title: Staff Senate offering mini grants for staff professional development  | Marquette Today
text:
Staff Senate is offering mini grants for staff professional development, providing the opportunity for members of the campus community to pursue training and resources that will enhance their skills and help them contribute to the work of Marquette.
Interested staff members can apply for funding [online](https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=aC_jqy3HDUK1vXUMY6Jo5Ix7-ioQEzlDv90rVE-cHklUMURTU0lLTkhEVDQ3M0oxTVpOSVkyUDJIUi4u&route=shorturl) to support their professional growth. The maximum amount awarded to one individual will be $200.
The deadline to apply is Saturday, Dec. 14. Supervisor approval is required.
Applicants will be notified if they are awarded a grant by Friday, Dec. 20.
Possible opportunities include but are not limited to:
- Online webinars
- Classes (outside of Marquette and the tuition remission benefit)
- Courses related to employee’s current role will be given preference to courses proposed for future development
- Registration for conference attendance (Travel, meals and housing would not be covered)
Eligibility
Any regular, full-time or part-time employee who has been employed for at least one year as of July 1 eligible.
Note: These funds cannot be used for professional dues as the focus is on education and development for employees.
About Staff Senate
The University Staff Senate is a group of elected individuals who represent Marquette staff so that their views and interests may be considered, alongside those of faculty and students, in the conduct of institutional affairs that affect life in the workplace and in the advancement of the university’s mission.
Staff Senate convenes every third Thursday of the month at 11 a.m. Learn more on the [Staff Senate website](https://www.marquette.edu/staff-senate/).
